data.name: CIS 122 #3 Simple Operations
data.description:
This kata builds on the previous kata:

* [CIS 122 #1 Simple Printing](http://www.codewars.com/kata/55cd156ead636caae3000099)
* [CIS 122 #2 Simple Input](http://www.codewars.com/kata/55ceadf20f7ff25be1000026)

In this challenge, we'll be learning about the pseudocode for Integer, Real, String, and Boolean operations, and how to translate them into Python. The pseudocode standard used in this challenge is based on the book [Starting Out with Programming Logic and Design, 3rd Edition](http://www.pearsonhighered.com/product?ISBN=0132805456) by Tony Gaddis.

The challenge itself consists of a number of pseudocode examples with an integrated tutorial that explains how to translate the pseudocode into Python.

If you want to test code that uses x_print in Python 3 outside of the CodeWars site, add this line to the top of the code:
```
x_print = print
```
